1.speaker: PANDA
1.japanese: 笹を食べながらのんびりするのは最高だなぁ
1.english: Chilling and eating bamboo grass is the best thing ever.

2.speaker: PANDA MAMA
2.japanese: ちょっと  またこの子は昼間からゴロゴロして
2.english: Hey now. Look at you, being so lazy so early in the day.

3.speaker: PANDA MAMA
3.japanese: 掃除の邪魔よ  どきなさい
3.english: You're in the way of my cleaning. Scoot.

5.speaker: PANDA
5.japanese: お母さん  おかわり

6.speaker: PANDA MAMA
6.japanese: どうするの  あなた将来は
6.english: Exactly what do you have planned for your future?

7.speaker: PANDA
7.japanese: もう  ゴロゴロしてるときに  将来の話なんかしないでよ
7.english: Jeez... Could we not talk about my future when I'm relaxing?

8.speaker: PANDA MAMA
8.japanese: 暇があるなら  ちょっとはバイトでも探しなさい
8.english: If you have so much time to relax, you could go look for a part-time job. I'm too busy relaxing, so I'll do it later. Don't try to suck me up!

10.speaker: PANDA
10.japanese: どうしてお母さんはゴロゴロする忙しさが分かんないんだろな
10.english: I wonder why Mom can't understand how much time relaxing takes up.

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: えーと  働かないでお金がもらえる仕事が載っているのはどれですか
11.english: Excuse me, which of these will have jobs where I can get paid to do nothing?

12.speaker: CLERK
12.english: I don't think there is one.

14.speaker: PANDA
14.japanese: どうせなら  お洒落なバイトがいいなぁ
14.english: If I really have to work, I'd prefer a really fancy job.

17.speaker: PANDA
17.japanese: あ  もしもし  パンダと申しますが
17.english: Oh, hi, my name is Panda.

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: そちらでデザインなー  デザイナーのアルバイト募集してますよね
18.english: You're advertising a part-time position for a designer, right?

19.speaker: PERSON
19.japanese: ええ  そうですよ  経験は？
19.english: Yes, we are. Do you have experience?

21.speaker: PERSON
21.japanese: パソコンのマウスは使えますか
21.english: Are you able to use a computer mouse?

22.speaker: PANDA
22.japanese: 使えないです  あんまり細かい作業はできません
22.english: Not at all! I'm not very good with detailed work.

23.speaker: PERSON
23.japanese: そうですか  得意なことはありますか
23.english: I see. Do you have anything you're good at?

25.speaker: PANDA
25.japanese: 笹を食べたり  寝ながらぼんやりするのが得意です
25.english: I'm good at eating bamboo grass, and zoning out while lying down.

27.speaker: PANDA
27.japanese: もしもし  そちらでインテリアコーディネーターも募集してますよね
27.english: Oh, hello? You're also advertising a position for an interior coordinator, right?

29.speaker: PANDA
29.japanese: インテリアコーディネーターって  なんですか
29.english: What, exactly, is an interior coordinator?

30.speaker: PANDA MAMA
30.english: There you are being lazy again.

31.speaker: PANDA MAMA
31.japanese: アルバイト見つかったの
31.english: Did you find a part-time job?

33.speaker: PANDA MAMA
33.japanese: 確かコンビニで募集してたでしょう
33.english: Weren't there openings at the convenience store?

34.speaker: PANDA
34.english: The convenience store? They have too many things. I won't be able to remember them all! Don't try to suck me up!

35.speaker: PANDA
35.japanese: もう  外でだらだらしようっと
35.english: Jeez. I think I'll wander around outside. Huh?  A string. Could you get it? Sure. Got it!

37.speaker: PANDA
37.english: Stay right there. Hey, wait! Wow, I didn't know there was a café here. Hello.

38.speaker: POLAR BEAR
38.japanese: ようこそ  しろくまカフェへ

39.speaker: POLAR BEAR
39.japanese: お客様  お一人様ですか
39.english: Table for one, sir? Oh, well, I'm not exactly a custo—

40.speaker: POLAR BEAR
40.english: Please have a seat anywhere you like.

42.speaker: POLAR BEAR
42.english: May I take your order? Let's see... Do you have bamboo?

43.speaker: POLAR BEAR
43.english: We don't have any bamboo. Then could I get bamboo grass?

44.speaker: POLAR BEAR
44.english: We don't have bamboo grass either. Then I'll have an iced coffee.

47.speaker: PENGUIN
47.japanese: 財布のポイントカードって増えすぎちゃわない
47.english: Do you ever get too many point cards in your wallet?

48.speaker: POLAR BEAR
48.japanese: ペンギンさん  ポイント貯める派

49.speaker: PENGUIN
49.english: Yep.  Oh, could I get another café mocha? Seconds {\i1}(okawari){\i0}. What?

51.speaker: PENGUIN
51.english: That would be the daily special {\i1}(higawari){\i0}.

56.speaker: PENGUIN
56.japanese: このカフェ  ダジャレがなければなぁ
56.english: You know, if it weren't for all the puns in this café...

57.speaker: PENGUIN
57.japanese: そういえば  アルバイト募集してるんだって
57.english: By the way, I heard you were looking for a part-timer?

58.speaker: POLAR BEAR
58.japanese: うん  人手が足りなくて

59.speaker: POLAR BEAR
59.japanese: ペンギンさん  どう

60.speaker: PENGUIN
60.japanese: え？ぼく  お客とバイトの両立  できるかな
60.english: Who, me? I wonder if I could handle being a customer and a part-timer.

61.speaker: POLAR BEAR
61.japanese: ウーソ  これから四名ほど  面接に来るんだよ
61.english: Just kidding.  I have about four interviews lined up.

62.speaker: PENGUIN
62.japanese: なんだ  ちょっと考えちゃったよ
62.english: Oh.  And here I was actually considering it.

63.speaker: PANDA
63.english: Could I have an interview, too?

64.speaker: PANDA
64.japanese: 僕もアルバイトしたいと思って
64.english: I was also thinking of working part-time.

66.speaker: PENGUIN
66.english: What?! Well then, will the first applicant please come up.

69.speaker: POLAR BEAR
69.japanese: えーと  ホール係やれますか
69.english: Let's see...  Would you be able to work the hall?

70.speaker: BADGER
70.japanese: はい  ホールなら任せてください
70.english: Yes!  You can leave the holes to me!

71.speaker: BADGER
71.japanese: 穴を掘るの  得意なんです
71.english: I'm a pro at digging holes!

72.speaker: PENGUIN
72.japanese: いや  そのホールは違うし

76.speaker: POLAR BEAR
76.japanese: 料理とか  運べますか
76.english: Are you able to carry orders?

80.speaker: TORTOISE
80.english: Please let me work about a hundred years.

81.speaker: POLAR BEAR
81.english: Er, I don't think that'll be possible.

84.speaker: POLAR BEAR
84.english: Not exactly what we're looking for.

86.speaker: ANTEATER
86.japanese: い  威嚇ができます

88.speaker: POLAR BEAR
88.english: Will the last applicant step up, please.

92.speaker: PENGUIN
92.japanese: やっとまともな人が来たね

93.speaker: POLAR BEAR
93.japanese: パンダ君  何か得意なことはありますか
93.english: Is there anything you're good at, Panda?

94.japanese: はい  ゴロゴロしながら笹を食べることです
94.english: Yes! I'm very good at lying around and eating bamboo grass.

96.speaker: POLAR BEAR
96.japanese: えーと  条件に希望はありますか
96.english: Er, let's see... Are there any specific conditions you'd like to request?

98.speaker: POLAR BEAR
98.japanese: うん  週二日ですか
98.english: Hm, you'd prefer two days? Oh, you mean I could just work one day a week?

99.speaker: POLAR BEAR
99.japanese: いや  せめて週四日くらい
99.english: No, no.  I was hoping for at least four days a week. I definitely can't do that.

100.speaker: PANDA
100.english: Oh, but... if you pick me up, I'll come right away.

101.speaker: POLAR BEAR
101.japanese: 僕が呼びに行くんですか
101.english: I have to come and get you? Oh, of course not.

102.speaker: PANDA
102.japanese: 遅刻した場合だけですよ

103.speaker: PENGUIN
103.english: You have every intention of being late, don't you?

104.speaker: POLAR BEAR
104.japanese: ちなみに  やる気はありますか
104.english: Just curious... do you really intend to work?

108.speaker: ALL
108.english: What?! Are you really that surprised?

110.speaker: POLAR BEAR
110.english: ...I wasn't able to find a part-timer. That's too bad. You're still here?!

111.speaker: PANDA
111.japanese: 家に帰ると  お母さんに吸われるし
111.english: If I go home, my mom will try to suck me up.

114.speaker: GIRL
114.japanese: あのう　面接中すみません
114.english: Pardon me, I hate to interrupt you during your interviews.

115.speaker: SLOTH
115.english: I would like to live in...

117.speaker: GIRL
117.japanese: あのう  アルバイト希望じゃないみたいですよ
117.english: I don't think he meant a live-in employee.

118.speaker: SLOTH
118.japanese: 庭に住み込みたいんですー
118.english: I would like to live in your yard.

119.speaker: GIRL
119.japanese: ここまで運んで欲しいって　頼まれちゃいまして
119.english: He asked me if I would bring him here.

120.speaker: POLAR BEAR
120.english: What is your name, Miss? Who, me?  It's Sasako.

124.speaker: PANDA
124.japanese: 僕今日、すごくいい感じのカフェ見つけちゃったよ
124.english: I found a really neat café today.

125.speaker: PANDA
125.japanese: しろくまカフェって言うんだけど

126.speaker: PANDA MAMA
126.japanese: なんに言ってるの？知ってるわよ
126.english: What are you talking about? Of course I know about it.

128.speaker: PANDA MAMA
128.japanese: ずっと前からあるじゃない？
128.english: It's been there for a really long time.

131.speaker: POLAR BEAR
131.japanese: はい、しろくまカフェです
131.english: Hello, this is Polar Bear's Café.

132.speaker: PANDA
132.japanese: あ　こんにちは　先日面接にいった、パンダですよ
132.english: Oh, hello. This is Panda, who you interviewed the other day.

133.speaker: POLAR BEAR
133.english: Oh, the one who didn't pass.

134.speaker: PANDA
134.japanese: 出前を お願いしたいんです
134.english: I would like to place a delivery order.

135.speaker: POLAR BEAR
135.japanese: 出前はやってないですが
135.english: I'm sorry, we don't do deliveries. Even though you're right next door?

136.speaker: POLAR BEAR
136.english: Not to mention we're quite busy right now. Aww...

137.speaker: PANDA
137.japanese: どうすれば出前してくれるの？
137.english: What would it take for you to make a delivery?

141.speaker: PANDA
141.english: I was looking for a job. Come on, you're right next door, so make a delivery.

143.speaker: PANDA
143.japanese: あああ～～～～　吸わないで～～～
143.english: Waah, please don't suck me up!

147.speaker: POLAR BEAR
147.japanese: ペンギンさん、何にする？
147.english: What would you like, Mr. Penguin? Let's see...

150.speaker: SASAKO
150.japanese: えっ？！いつものやつって  言われたんですけど
150.english: What?! He asked for... the usual.

151.speaker: POLAR BEAR
151.english: Leave it to me. Here's your curry rice.

152.speaker: SASAKO
152.english: Apparently that wasn't it. I knew it.

154.speaker: PANDA
154.japanese: あの、竹か笹はないんですか
154.english: Excuse me, do you not have any bamboo or bamboo grass?

156.speaker: PANDA
156.english: Then could I get an iced coffee?

157.speaker: POLAR BEAR
157.japanese: あ、君バイト探してたよね
157.english: You were looking for a part-time job, weren't you?

160.speaker: FISHERMAN
160.japanese: 経験者大歓迎、激しく重労働
160.english: We will gladly accept those with experience! Intense physical labor!

162.speaker: PANDA
162.english: No way!  Not to mention, I can't swim!

163.speaker: PENGUIN
163.japanese: こっちのがいいじやない？
163.english: I think this one is better.

164.speaker: ZOO KEEP
164.japanese: 動物園  未経験者歓迎
164.english: The zoo is accepting applicants without experience.

165.speaker: ZOO KEEP
165.english: We will gladly accommodate work days.

166.speaker: PANDA
166.japanese: 先ずはお電話ください　フリアイ動物園
166.english: "Please give us a call. The Petting Zoo."

167.speaker: POLAR BEAR
167.english: You should totally go with the tuna boat.

169.speaker: PANDA
169.japanese: 動物園か　面白そう
169.english: The zoo, huh?  That sounds fun!

170.speaker: ZOO KEEP
170.japanese: えっと  週二日の勤務希望ですか？
170.english: Let's see, so you're looking to work two days a week?

172.speaker: ZOO KEEP
172.japanese: では、パンダの仕事はどうでしょう？
172.english: Then would you be interested in the position of "panda"? Huh?

173.speaker: ZOO KEEP
173.japanese: 常勤パンダさんが一頭いるですが

174.speaker: ZOO KEEP
174.japanese: 非常勤でもう一頭募集してるんです
174.english: but we're also looking to fill a part-time slot.

175.speaker: PANDA
175.japanese: パンダって　あのパンダですよね
175.english: When you say "panda," you do mean {\i1}that{\i0} panda, right?

177.speaker: ZOO KEEP
177.japanese: でしたら　月の輪熊とゴリラも募集していますよ
177.english: In that case, we are looking for an Asian black bear and a gorilla.

179.speaker: ZOO KEEP
179.japanese: そうですか、では、来週から来てください
179.english: I see.  Then please begin coming next week.

180.speaker: PANDA
180.english: I found a part-time job. Really?  That's great to hear! The tuna boat?

181.speaker: PANDA
181.english: No way.  The zoo. What part-time job are you going to be doing at the zoo? It's a secret.

183.speaker: PANDA
183.japanese: いよいよ今日からバイトか　ドキドキしちゃうなぁ
183.english: Today's the day I start my part-time job. I'm so excited. Hello again, my name is Handa.

184.speaker: HANDA
184.japanese: 今日は幼稚園から園児たちが来ます
184.english: We will have some preschool visitors today.

185.speaker: HANDA
185.japanese: 少しサービスしてあげてください
185.english: Please give them a little extra service.

187.speaker: PANDA
187.japanese: サービスですね　分かりました

188.speaker: PANDA
188.japanese: それ以外の時間はどんな感じで？
188.english: What should I be doing the rest of the time?

191.speaker: PENGUIN
191.japanese: パンダ君うまくやってるかなぁ～
191.english: How do you think Panda's doing?

192.speaker: POLAR BEAR
192.japanese: きっと大漁だよ、まぐろ船
192.english: I'm sure he'll get a huge haul on the tuna boat.

193.speaker: PENGUIN
193.english: You're not letting go of that, are you? Oh, could I get a café mocha?

194.speaker: PENGUIN
194.japanese: って、それは  影武者、いいから、そういうの
194.english: Um... That would be a body double {\i1}(kagemusha){\i0}. Honestly, you don't have to do that.

195.speaker: PANDA
195.english: Really?  Seven days a week? You don't have a day off?

196.speaker: FTPANDA
196.japanese: あたしは常勤パンダですからね
196.english: Well, I am a full-time panda.

197.speaker: FTPANDA
197.japanese: でも月に二日くらいは休みますよ
197.english: But I do take about two days off a month.

198.speaker: PANDA
198.english: I'm so glad I'm part-time. Well, it'll be a pleasure working with you.

203.speaker: HANDA
203.japanese: 自然態でって言われたんです
203.english: ...naturally. is how I should act. I see.

204.speaker: PANDA
204.japanese: こんな感じでしょうか？自然と一体的な？
204.english: Is it something like this? Does this look like I'm one with nature?

205.speaker: FTPANDA
205.japanese: 多分違うと思う　というか　すごく不自然
205.english: I don't think that's what he meant. Or rather, that's very unnatural. Well, you don't have to worry so much. Just act like normal and you'll be fine. Oh...

207.speaker: TEACHER
207.japanese: はい　皆　パンダさんですよ

208.speaker: FTPANDA
208.japanese: あ　園児が来ましたね
208.english: Oh, looks like the preschool kids are here.

209.speaker: FTPANDA
209.japanese: さ～　頑張りましょう
209.english: Let's give it our best. O-Okay! Look, the pandas are eating!

211.speaker: KID-B
211.japanese: はは～パンダさんは滑り台滑ってるの
211.english: Look, the pandas are playing on the slide! Yes, they are.

212.speaker: KID-C
212.japanese: パンダさんが転がってるよ
212.english: Look, the pandas are rolling around!

214.speaker: PANDA
214.japanese: これでサービスになってるんですか？
214.english: Is this what they consider service?

215.speaker: FTPANDA
215.japanese: もうちょっとの辛抱ですよ～
215.english: It's just for a little while longer.

216.speaker: FTPANDA
216.japanese: あ～　もう一サービスしましょう
216.english: All right, let's give it one more go!

219.speaker: TEACHER
219.japanese: 皆、次はキリンさんを見ましょう
219.english: Okay, everyone.  Let's go see the giraffes next.

224.speaker: PANDA
224.english: Service, service... I totally fell asleep.

225.speaker: PANDA
225.japanese: なんで起こしてくれないんですか、常勤パンダさん、え！
225.english: Why didn't you wake me up, Mr. Full-Time Panda?

226.speaker: VOICE
226.japanese: 閉園の時間になりました　またのご来園をお待ちしております
226.english: {\a6\i1}The zoo will now be closing. {\a6\i1}Please come again.

227.speaker: HANDA
227.english: Thank you for all your hard work today.

231.speaker: SASAKO
231.japanese: お知り合いなんですか
231.english: Do you all know each other?

232.speaker: LLAMA
232.japanese: 僕たちも動物園でバイトしてるんですよ
232.english: We're working part-time at the zoo, as well.

233.speaker: KOALA
233.japanese: パンダ君　こっちこっち

234.speaker: KOALA
234.japanese: 今日は園児が可愛かったね
234.english: The preschool kids were so cute today.

235.speaker: PANDA
235.japanese: 僕　張り切り過ぎでて  途中で  ばてちゃった
235.english: I over-exerted myself and passed out.

236.speaker: LLAMA
236.japanese: わかります　わかります

237.speaker: PANDA
237.japanese: 今日は一日真面目に働いたなぁ

239.speaker: PENGUIN
239.japanese: すごいやりきった顔だけど　パンダ君途中からずっと寝てたらしいよ
239.english: He looks so satisfied with himself,

240.speaker: PANDA
240.japanese: すごいやりきった顔だけど　パンダ君途中からずっと寝てたらしいよ
240.english: {\a6}I feel so fulfilled. but apparently he slept half the time. {\a6}I know where you're coming from. I guess that's "acting naturally" to him.

241.speaker: PENGUIN
241.japanese: パンダ君って　割りと図々しいよね

242.speaker: LLAMA
242.japanese: パンダ君　一先何か頼みませんか？
242.english: Why don't you order something, Panda?

244.speaker: POLAR BEAR
244.english: What can I get for you?

246.speaker: PENGUIN
246.japanese: しろくま君　それは　守宮！

249.speaker: BOTH BEARS
249.japanese: 笹子さんが突っ込みを！

251.speaker: PANDA
251.english: Hey, can I get my bamboo, already?

252.speaker: PANDA
252.japanese: ペンギンさんペンギンさん

253.speaker: PANDA
253.japanese: 僕が全部毛を剃ると　どうなってると思う？
253.english: What do you think I'd look like if I shaved off all my hair? This isn't the time. We're supposed to be doing the preview.

254.speaker: PANDA
254.japanese: じゃ～さ　ペンギンさんのだめな部分三つ教えて
254.english: Then could you tell me three bad traits about yourself?

255.speaker: PENGUIN
255.japanese: それもいいかな　テンション下がっちゃうから
255.english: Let's not do that either, it'll bring the mood down.

256.speaker: PENGUIN
256.japanese: しろくま君　しゃべろう

257.speaker: POLAR BEAR
257.japanese: ペンギンさんのダメなところは　お金にだらしないところ
257.english: Mr. Penguin's bad trait is that he's bad with money.

259.speaker: POLAR BEAR
259.japanese: はい！次回しろくまカフェ最終回　お楽しみに
259.english: Okay. Next time on "Polar Bear's Café," the last episode.  Enjoy!

260.speaker: PENGUIN
260.japanese: 終わらせないよ　しろくまカフェ第二話　お楽しみに
260.english: I'm not letting you end with that! "Polar Bear's Café" episode two! Enjoy!
